Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the extent to which the Government Accountability Board ignored their duties and did not regularly audit voters to remove felons.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack sufficient evidence or support to prove that the Government Accountability Board ignored their duties and did not regularly audit voters to remove felons.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the non-completion of post-election felon audits translates to a complete failure to regularly audit voters for felons.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for why the post-election felon audits were not completed, such as concerns about the reliability of the system to identify felons on probation or parole.
